comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: Stale
labels.description: The issue is considered as obsolete

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.itv.com/watch/emmerdale/Ya0524/1a8694a10495](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.itv.com%2Fwatch%2Femmerdale%2FYa0524%2F1a8694a10495) ### Comment > Had this mid to late last year, the report was closed due to the tester not being able to replicate results however the whole reddit thread agreed they too were having issues. Suddenly after 2-3 weeks it began working again. Today I migrated to a new Mac M4 Max and with the EXACT same settings ITV are detecting AdGuard, however on my older intel MacBook running the EXACT same settings and same web login it is perfectly fine? So perhaps an OS issue. > > Older Intel MacBook is running Sequoia 15.7.3 ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/eepislypunwc048kg04g844owk444cgw0n9pmdhdmo.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Mac v2.18.0.2089 System version: | `Tahoe 26.1` Browser: | Safari Tracking protection: | disabled DNS filtering: | server: `System Default`

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

AdGuard for Android v2.8.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://rakuten.dropgame.jp/drop/play/top

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter

### Security

Online Malicious URL Blocklist

### Other

Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

AdGuard Japanese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>I called inquiry number 1147661 and everything was fine until now, but
when I run the game on the website below, ads start appearing.
The game operator responded the day before yesterday.
I've enabled and disabled various filters, but the ads still appear.
Sometimes they appear randomly, and they never go away.

Link:
https://rakuten.dropgame.jp/drop/play/top

 Since this is a Rakuten game, after creating an account, go to the following link:
https://pointmall.rakuten.co.jp/

Go to "Earn through games"  "Pukupuku Lagoon"  "Start now."
(
)

Link:
https://rakuten.wamgame.jp/whack/top

 Go to the following link:
https://pointmall.rakuten.co.jp/

Go to "Earn through games"  "Pokopoko Whack-a-Mole"  "Start now."
(
)

Thank you for your cooperation.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/223387#issuecomment-3809155243
> Je suis oblig de dsactiv Adguard pour continuer l'accs a la page demande !!

It has been fixed 2 days ago, but unfortunately, MV3 extension cannot update filters due to Google policy, so new rules will be available in one of the next extension updates.
Until then, please add following rules to user rules:
```adblock
upplinks.net,upfion.com,upfiles.app,upfiles-urls.com,falpus.com,fooak.com#@#.ads-container
upplinks.net,upfion.com,upfiles.app,upfiles-urls.com,falpus.com,fooak.com#$#.adsbygoogle.ads-container[style] { display: block !important; }
```

comment.body:
I'm not able to reproduce this `Upgrade` button, but I don't think that we should hide `Gemini` button.

By the way:
>I believe these buttons should be hidden when the "Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion" is active, as the current behavior seems to nudge users toward a Google subscription.

`Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion` is supposed to unblock, not to block things.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://public-cdn.cloud.unity3d.com/hub/prod/UnityHubSetup.exe](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpublic-cdn.cloud.unity3d.com%2Fhub%2Fprod%2FUnityHubSetup.exe) ### Comment > 1. Please reenact the problem by activating all the options in AdGuard's stealth mode. > 2. Run Unity Hub.exe with AdGuard enabled. > 3. Log in. > 4. If you click on the profile picture and click 'Manage Account', you will not be able to access the account management page, and you will get an error like the picture. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
> Perhaps `api.unity.com` is affected, that was I saw in the filtering log. Please check this.
> 
> @@||api.unity.com^$stealth=ip

@zloyden 
This rule resolves the problem.

comment.body:
This icon is from `AdGuard Assistant` userscript, it can be disabled in settings - https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/features/extensions/
You can also add following rule to user rules:
```adblock
@@||example.org^$extension='AdGuard Assistant'|'AdGuard Assistant (Beta)'
```
or
```adblock
@@||voice.google.com^$extension
```
to disable it only on `voice.google.com`.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
> Ok. But in this case it is hard to find which domain(s) was blocked. We have the private DNS https://adguard-dns.io/ - it has the filtering log. You may try to check with it.
> 
> But with your current configuration (AdGuard DNS Default server) you may record a HAR file. We can check what was blocked. Please record a HAR file of broken page and send it + link of this issue it to `filters@adguard.com` How to get a HAR file: https://toolbox.googleapps.com/apps/har_analyzer/

I had checked with another free service where I can see logs. Seems the domain blocked is
netcore.co.in

comment.body:
Ok. But in this case it is hard to find which domain(s) was blocked.
We have the private DNS https://adguard-dns.io/ - it has the filtering log. You may try to check with it. 

But with your current configuration (AdGuard DNS Default server) you may record a HAR file. We can check what was blocked.
Please record a HAR file of broken page and send it + link of this issue it to `filters@adguard.com`
How to get a HAR file:
https://toolbox.googleapps.com/apps/har_analyzer/

I mean if you are using

`https://www.walmart.com/`
the site loads fine.

Please add to user rules `@@||walmart.com^$jsinject`

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [https://www.johopkinsconsulting.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.johopkinsconsulting.com)
### Comment
> My business website http://www.johopkinsconsulting.com is being blocked by AdGuard DNS as a phishing or malicious website.
> 
> The site is hosted on the LearnWorlds platform and includes a secure login area for enrolled clients only. There is no phishing, malware, or impersonation activity.
> 
> We believe this is a false positive, possibly related to shared hosting infrastructure or automated login-page detection.
> 
> Performance Coaching for Sport and Business | Jo Hopkins Consulting
> 
> I'd be grateful if you could review and remove this domain from the AdGuard DNS blocklist
```
Username: @orlaghwatters
```

> @ron-png I don't see errors now - registered with one attempt.

With filter enabled?
